channel.title: Stories of the Forgotten
channel.itunes:subtitle: A podcast about becoming a new creation in Christ through service and ministry to the poor. Pastor Chris Aaron Rice shares his experience of service to those in need.
channel.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
channel.itunes:summary: Pastor Chris Aaron Rice serves as a leader in New Life Evangelistic Center. This nonprofit is dedicated to serving the poor and homeless throughout Mid-America. He has lived in deep community most of his life. Pastor Rice shares his experiences serving those in need. He studied Classical Languages and Archaeology at Calvin University in Grand Rapids MI. Pastor Rice builds off of the firm foundation laid down in scripture, when approaching how to serve others. Join us for a thought provoking podcast that digs deep into living a life for Christ. New Life is dedicated to be there when people are hurting. This podcast will look into what it takes to serve others when they need help most. God bless!
channel.description: Pastor Chris Aaron Rice serves as a leader in New Life Evangelistic Center. This nonprofit is dedicated to serving the poor and homeless throughout Mid-America. He has lived in deep community most of his life. Pastor Rice shares his experiences serving those in need. He studied Classical Languages and Archaeology at Calvin University in Grand Rapids MI. Pastor Rice builds off of the firm foundation laid down in scripture, when approaching how to serve others. Join us for a thought provoking podcast that digs deep into living a life for Christ. New Life is dedicated to be there when people are hurting. This podcast will look into what it takes to serve others when they need help most. God bless!

item.title: 10 Myths about Homelessness
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: How stigmas change the way we think about the homeless.
item.itunes:summary: There are many myths that society propagates about homeless individuals. Here are 10 myths that we commonly hear or believe about the less fortunate.

item.title: Communal Living Part 1
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: The complexities of intentional community and what we can learn from them.
item.itunes:summary: intentional community is not easy but it can teach us some valuable lessons about the brokenness in our society. We are social beings and so living in deep community is both humbling and rewarding in many ways.

item.title: Communal Living Part 2
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: New Life Evangelistic Center forms community.
item.itunes:summary: Pastor Chris Aaron Rice continues the conversation about intentional community. New Life Evangelistic Center is operated by another form of deep community. Join us as we share how NLEC uses intentional community to help homeless men and women break the cycle of homelessness.

item.title: Enabling VS Serving
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: Is outreach worth it?
item.itunes:summary: Serving can be be incredibly difficult especially when you feel as though you are enabling people in their situation. In this podcast we grapple with the tension between enabling vs service.

item.title: From Homeless To Leadership
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: A conversation on leadership featuring Quinton Forester
item.itunes:summary: Pastor Rice discusses Quinton experience in New Life's Adult Training Program. Quinton brings insight to the conversation as one who has lived on the streets of Springfield.

item.title: Service in the Bible
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: What does the Bible say about serving others?
item.itunes:summary: The Bible is a wonderful guide in spiritual development. What does it have to say about service? Pastor Rice breaks down some of the key scriptures that people point to when serving others.

item.title: The Church and Service
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: Christ's mission for the church and how Western Civilization has twisted it.
item.itunes:summary: Who is the church supposed to serve? How is the church supposed to serve. Join us as we dig into scripture to answer some of these tough questions.

item.title: Reviewing Letters to the Church by Francis Chan
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: Pastor Rice reviews Francis Chan's newest book.
item.itunes:summary: Letters to the Church is an excellent book calling churches in the US to change their mindset to Godliness. Francis Chan breaks down his experiences as a pastor at a megachurch, and the sharp lessons God taught him through those experiences. Join us as we seek to learn from his newest book.

item.title: Tales from the Streets
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: What is it like to live on the streets? Join us as we have a candid conversation with the Seefeldt.
item.itunes:summary: The Seefeldt lived on the streets for quite some time. They share their experiences and the people they came across living as a couple on the streets.

item.title: Free Service and Leadership
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: What right do leaders in the church have, and what should be required of the congregation? Join us as we discuss serving as leaders in a changing world.
item.itunes:summary: In 1 Corinthians 9 Paul challenges the church to think of service in a different light. He boldly states that apostles deserve the wages they earn from the congregation, but it is even better to witness and build the church for free. Paul's challenge gets to the root of what it means to be Christian in a secular world.

item.title: Being the Salt and Light
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: Jesus claims that his disciples are the salt and light of the earth. Join us as we discuss what that means and how it impacts our service.
item.itunes:summary: Chris Aaron Rice digs into the sermon on the mount. Jesus shows us a new way of serving and living in the world. He challenges us to constantly steer the conversation back to him. Join us!

item.title: Homelessness in Springfield
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: In the Buckle of the Bible Belt, why is there homelessness?
item.itunes:summary: What are some of the struggles nonprofits and local leaders face when addressing homelessness in Springfield MO. Join us as we dig into the conversation of homelessness in Springfield MO.

item.title: Family and Service Part 1
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: How does our family life impact how we serve?
item.itunes:summary: Join us as we discuss family relationships and how these relationships impact how we serve. Pastor Rice brings his own experience as a new father on how to serve with a family.

item.title: Family and Service Part 2
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: How does our family life impact how we serve?
item.itunes:summary: Join us as we discuss family relationships and how these relationships impact how we serve. Pastor Rice brings his own experience as a new father on how to serve with a family.

item.title: Perseverance through Trials
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: How do we love others when suffering ourselves? Join us for a conversation about fulfilling our Biblical mandate to love others while going through personal trials.
item.itunes:summary: The COVID-19 pandemic has shaken the entire world. How are Christians supposed to be responding? What does the Bible say about perseverance through trials? Pastor Chris Aaron shares his views on the state of Christianity and the need for more service during this epidemic.

item.title: Generosity Burnout
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: Join us for a conversation about generosity burnout and how to avoid it.
item.itunes:summary: There are many legitimate problems and crises in the world. It is easy to become overwhelmed by all the sin and injustice on earth. Join us this week as we break down how to fight against generosity burnout.

item.title: The Aftermath of COVID-19
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: Taking adversity and turning it into thriving change.
item.itunes:summary: The coronavirus pandemic has taught the world many lessons. Join us as we discuss ways the church can grow through the adversity.

item.title: Serving through Persecution
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: Finding Peace in Suffering and Being a Living Witness.
item.itunes:summary: Join us as we discuss how persecution can help further the kingdom of God, even in the midst of the most vicious trials.

item.title: Dirty Lenses
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: How do your experiences and perspectives shape how you see life?
item.itunes:summary: Join us for a conversation about different worldview lenses and how that shapes how we serve others.

item.title: Obstacles the Homeless Face
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: Legitimate barriers that stop men or women from breaking the cycle of homelessness.
item.itunes:summary: Today we talk about some of the complex barriers homeless individuals face and the stigmas that attempt to simplify them.

item.title: Stories of the Forgotten
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: Chris and Katie share their hearts on ministering to segments of society that are often forgotten.
item.itunes:summary: Through missions to other countries and ministry experience at home, both Chris and Katie share what they have learned from ministering to the lost and forgotten.

item.title: Who is Your Neighbor
item.itunes:author: Chris Aaron Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: What does Jesus mean when he talks about mercy and compassion for sinners? Join us as we share what it means to be a neighbor in the Bible.
item.itunes:summary: Chris and Katie share what Biblical compassion looks like and we hear a story of Linda. Join us in this exciting episode of Stories of the Forgotten.
